alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM MDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to Runoff from overnight heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hagerman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
